weather_report:
Current conditions in Evanston are chilly, with temperatures hovering in the low 20s and a thick blanket of clouds overhead. The atmosphere feels damp and crisp, indicative of a typical winter evening. As the night deepens, temperatures are expected to rise slightly to around 26 degrees with a brisk south-southwest wind picking up, creating a blustery feel that may evoke a bit of discomfort for those unprepared for the chill. 

Tomorrow, scattered snow showers are expected to roll in after 2 PM, accompanied by a high near 38 degrees. Winds will intensify, blowing at 20 to 25 mph with gusts potentially reaching 45 mph. While the chance of snow is around 50%, little to no accumulation is anticipated. Given this wintry mix, layering will be crucial; a warm coat, hat, and gloves are essential attire for navigating the brisk conditions. With the season at the cusp of December, temperatures align with the regional expectations for this time of year. Ideal activities include cozy indoor pursuits, perhaps sipping hot cocoa or reading by a warm fire as the wintry weather unfolds outside.
